alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Orange; Putnam (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:54AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Westchester, east central Orange and Putnam Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 1254 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cold Spring, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mahopac, Lake Carmel, West Point, Brewster, Cold Spring, Carmel, Fahnestock State Park, Jefferson Valley, Patterson, Putnam Valley, Firthcliffe, Highland Falls, Putnam Lake, Cornwall On Hudson and Brewster Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
